required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Reducing Hazardous Alcohol Use in Social Networks Using Targeted Intervention: 21 Rising
clinical_study.official_title: Reducing Hazardous Alcohol Use in Social Networks Using Targeted Intervention: 21 Rising

collaborator.agency: National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism (NIAAA)

brief_summary.textblock: The primary goal of this study is to determine whether change in alcohol use among college students can be transmitted through social network ties to other members in the network. Members of one college class at a northeastern university will be enrolled in a longitudinal study in which they will provide self-reported behavioral information and information about their social ties to others in their college class. A subset of heavy drinking participants will be asked to meet in person to complete an interview about their alcohol use - called a Brief Motivational Interview. There is evidence that this sort of interview can reduce harmful alcohol use. The investigators expect that following the Brief Motivational Interview others in their friendship clusters will show reduced harm associated with alcohol use as well.

primary_outcome.time_frame: At each follow up, measure average drinks per week in the past 30 days
primary_outcome.description: Average number of drinks per week in the past 30 days

primary_outcome.measure: Average number of alcohol consequences in the past 30 days
primary_outcome.time_frame: At each follow up, measure count of alcohol consequences in the past 30 days
primary_outcome.description: Count of alcohol consequences in the past 30 days

arm_group.description: Single-session in person conversation focusing on risks associated with alcohol use.

intervention.description: Single (60 min) session discussion of alcohol use and associated experiences.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
• Must be a member of the class of 2021 or 2021.5 at the site university
Exclusion Criteria:
• None

patient_data.ipd_description: There is concern that with information in the dataset, including social ties, individuals could be re-identified.
